locale.message: DNB URN
This plugin enables the assignment of Uniform Resource Names according to the DNB to publication formats in OMP.
URN Plugin Settings
Please configure the URN plug-in to be able to manage and use URNs in OMP:
URN Plugin Settings Updated
Publication Format Content
Please choose the objects URNs should be assigned to.
Please select the publishing objects that will have Unform Resource Identifiers (URN) assigned:
URN Prefix
The URN Prefix is assigned by registration agencies (e.g. CrossRef) and is in the format 10.xxxx (e.g. 10.1234):
The URN prefix is mandatory and must be in the form urn:[...].
URN Suffix
A URN Suffix choice is required.
A URN suffix can take any form, but must be unique among all publishing objects with the same URN prefix assigned:
Use the pattern entered below to generate URN suffixes. Use %p for press initials, %m for the monograph id, and %f for the publication format unique id.
for publication formats
For example, press%ppub%f could create a URN such as 10.1234/pressESPpub100
Use default patterns.
%p.%m.%f for publication formats.
Use the "Custom Identifier" for published items as the URN suffix (must be enabled in Step 4). This is the same identifier that will be used for public URLs.

Enter an individual URN suffix for each published item independent and different from the "Custom Identifier" mentioned in the previous option. You'll find an additional URN input field on each item's meta-data page.
Please enter the URN suffix pattern for publication formats.
Reassign URNs

If you change your URN configuration, URNs that have already been assigned will not be affected. Once the URN configuration is saved, use this button to clear all existing URNs so that the new settings will take effect with existing publication formats.
